newsitem.title: USA: National sees Q1 and 1997 below estimates.
newsitem.headline: National sees Q1 and 1997 below estimates.

text.p: National Processing Inc said on Wednesday it expects first-quarter and full-year 1997 earnings to be significantly below analysts' consensus estimates, primarily due to unanticipated weakness in its Merchant Services division.

First Call's consensus estimates were net income of $0.12 per share for the first quarter and $0.73 per share for the year. If current trends continue, National said, its full-year results could fall as much as a third below the consensus estimate.
National Processing shares were trading at 10-1/2 late Wednesday morning, level with where they closed Tuesday.
National Processing provides transaction processing services. It is 85-percent owned by National City Corp, a banking and financial services company based in Cleveland.
